sub_topic: Determine the Hopf map of a manifold.
message_1:
A math student needs to determine the Hopf map of a manifold given the equation of the manifold as follows: 

M = {(x,y,z,w) ∈ ℝ⁴ | x² + y² + z² + w² = 1} 

The student needs to calculate the Hopf map h: M → S² where S² is the 2-dimensional sphere, given by: 

h(x,y,z,w) = (2xy + 2zw, 2xz - 2yw, x² - y² - z² + w²) / (x² + y² + z² + w²) 

Calculate h for any given point on the manifold M.
message_2:
Since the manifold M is defined by the equation x² + y² + z² + w² = 1, any point (x, y, z, w) on M already satisfies this equation. Therefore, we can directly apply the Hopf map formula to calculate h(x, y, z, w) for any given point on M.

h(x, y, z, w) = (2xy + 2zw, 2xz - 2yw, x² - y² - z² + w²) / (x² + y² + z² + w²)

Since x² + y² + z² + w² = 1 for any point on M, we can simplify the Hopf map formula as:

h(x, y, z, w) = (2xy + 2zw, 2xz - 2yw, x² - y² - z² + w²)

So, for any given point (x, y, z, w) on the manifold M, the Hopf map h(x, y, z, w) can be calculated using the simplified formula above.
